## Quad Remesh Parameters
   (Tab: LunchBox > Panel: Mesh)

   INPUTS:
   - QuadCount [Target Quad Count]: "If compute quads based on a target number of quads."
   - Adaptive? [Use Adaptive Quads]: "Respect the Target Quad Count as much as possible. If true, more quads will be used in areas of high curvature."
   - AdaptiveSize [Adaptive Quad Size]: "Target size of the adaptive quads used in the remeshing"
   - DetectEdges? [Detect Hard Edges]: "If true, try to detect and preserve hard edges of the object."
   - PreserveEdges? [Preserve Mesh Array Hard Edges]: "0=off, 1=On(Smart), 2=On(Strict) : Mesh array's created from Breps will have their brep face edge boundaries retained."
   - Symmetry [Symmetry Axis]: "0=None, 1=X, 2=Y, 3=Z : Symmetry axis to use in remeshing."
   - GuideInfuence [Guide Curve Influence]: "0=Approximate, 1=Interpolate Edge Ring, 2=Interpolate Edge Loop : This value is ignored if Guide Curves are not supplied"
   - Edge Length [Target Edge Length]: "If >0 then compute quads based on edge lengths (NOTE: Overrides adaptive count/size parameters when used)"

   OUTPUTS:
   - Parameters [Remesh Parameters]: "Parameters for the Quad Remesh operation."

----------------------------------------

## Twisted Box Through Curves
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Twisted Box)

   INPUTS:
   - C [Curves]: "Set of curves to create twisted box array through"
   - T [Thickness]: "Overall thickness of the twisted box array, offset from the curves"
   - u [Parameters U]: "Division parameters through curves {u} domain ({u}0.0 = Curve at C start, {u}1.0 = Curve at C end), unless Normalized is False

For best results {u} parameters should be between 0 and 1, in numerical order, and non duplicate"
   - v [Parameters V]: "Division parameters along curve {v} domains ({v}0.0 = Curve starts, {v}1.0 = Curve ends)

For best results {v} parameters should be between 0 and 1, in numerical order, and non duplicate"
   - w [Parameters W]: "Division parameters along thickness {w} domain ({w}0.0 = Curves, {w}1.0 = Thickness)

For best results {w} parameters should be between 0 and 1, in numerical order, and non duplicate"
   - N [Normalized]: "If False, the rules for {u} parameters are ({u}0.0 = Curve at index 0, {u}Index number of last curve = Curve at last index)

For best results {u} parameters should be between 0 and the index of the last curve, in numerical order, and non duplicate"
   - E [Equalized]: "If True, parameters {u} distribution is evaluated along the interpolation path without considering the locations of the input curve set"
   - W [Weighted]: "If True, parameters {v} distribution is weighted by the input curves curvatures"
   - I [Interpolation Type]: "Determines how the {u} interpolation path is interpolated

0 = Straight
1 = Normal
2 = Tight
3 = Uniform"
   - R [Refit]: "Optional Refit match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and curve degree of refit)

If an integer greater than zero, Refit match method is used if possible. When input curves are refit their control points are redistributed, added to, and removed from based on the curves curvature and the input integer degree, while trying to maintain their shapes. Refit results in tighter shaped twisted boxes, with curvature based control point distribution."
   - P [Point Sample]: "Optional Point Sample match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and amount of sample points) 

If an integer greater than zero, Point Sample match method is used. When input curves are sampled their control points are recreated by equally dividing the curve by the input integer point count. Point Sample results in looser shaped twisted boxes, with uniform control point distribution."

   OUTPUTS:
   - TB [Twisted Boxes]: "Resulting twisted box array through curves"

----------------------------------------

## Sweep Unsplit Surface
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Surface)

   INPUTS:

   - R¹ [Rail 1]: "Rail curve to sweep along (best if flowing from first Section in S to last Section in S)"

   OUTPUTS:
   - U [Unsplit]: "Resulting untrimmed single unsplit swept surface

When you bake this surface into Rhino it will become a usual polysurface(Brep) which is split at its kinks if it has kinks, unless you first run the command CreaseSplitting in Rhino's command line and turn it off by switching it to No. If this surface has kinks you can turn it into a polysurface(Brep) using Pufferfish's Split Kinky Surface component"

## Tween Through Planes On Curve
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Plane)

   INPUTS:
   - Pl [Planes]: "Set of planes on curve to tween through"
   - C [Curve]: "Curve to tween plane on"
   - F [Factor]: "Tween factor (0.0 = Plane at index 0, Index number of last plane = Plane at last index), unless Normalized is true

The tween factor range from one plane to the next plane in the list is:
Index number of a plane = the plane at that index, Index number of the next plane = the next plane in the list, factors between the plane index numbers will be the corresponding tweens.

For instance:
A tween factor of 2.5 will result in a tween plane halfway between the plane at index 2 and the plane at index 3."
   - N [Normalized]: "If True, use a normalized tween factor (Factor 0.0 = Plane at Pl start, Factor 1.0 = Plane at Pl end)"
   - Q [Quaternion]: "Interpolate with quaternion rotation"

   OUTPUTS:
   - T [Tween]: "Resulting tween plane on curve"

----------------------------------------

Profile should preferably be a quadrilateral polygon (4 sided polyline with 4 corners). If profile is not a quadrilateral polygon it will be converted. Profile does not need to be planar or closed. Triangles are acceptable."
   - D [Direction]: "Extrusion direction vector, curve, or point

Input a vector to exrude along a vector
Input a curve to exrude along a curve
Input a point to extrude to a point"
   - t [Parameters T]: "Division parameters along the extrusion {t} domain (0.0 = Extrusion start, 1.0 = Extrusion end)

For best results parameters should be between 0 and 1, in numerical order, and non duplicate"
   - W [Weighted]: "If True, parameters {t} distribution is weighted by the input direction curves curvature if a curve is used for the extrusion direction"

The decimal places of this number can only be displayed up until the amount set in Grasshopper's formatting options (File>Preferences>Display>Formatting), those settings only change how a number is displayed, they do not change the actual value of the number itself. Additionally, unecessary trailing zeros won't be displayed because of Grasshopper."

## Loft Ex
   (Tab: Wombat > Panel: Surface)

   INPUTS:
   - C [Curves]: "The Loft Sections"
   - S [Start]: "The point at the loft start"
   - E [End]: "The point at the loft end"
   - O [Options]: "Loft options"

   OUTPUTS:
   - L [Loft]: "Loft Results"

----------------------------------------

## Rotate Plane
   (Tab: Vector > Panel: Plane)

   INPUTS:
   - P [Plane]: "Plane to rotate"
   - A [Angle]: "Rotation (counter clockwise) around plane z-axis in radians"

   OUTPUTS:
   - P [Plane]: "Rotated plane"

----------------------------------------

## Mirror Cut Mesh
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Mesh)

   INPUTS:
   - M [Mesh]: "Mesh to mirror cut"
   - MP [Mirror Plane]: "Plane that the kept side of the mesh cut gets mirrored across"
   - R [Reach]: "Parts of the mesh within this distance from the mirror plane will be additionally cut away"
   - O [Offset]: "Distance to offset the kept parts of the mesh from the mirror plane (or offset from the reach if reach in not zero)"
   - F [Flip]: "Flip the mirror direction"
   - J [Join]: "Join the mirror cut mesh"
   - K [Keep]: "Keep the mesh and mirror it normally if it is mirror cut into non-existence"
   - T [Connection Type]: "Determines how the mirror cut meshes are connected

0 = Split faces, with connection
1 = Remove faces, with connection
2 = Shrink faces, with connection
3 = Split faces, without connection
4 = Remove faces, without connection
5 = Shrink faces, without connection"
   - B [Bulge]: "Bulge factor for the mirror cut mesh connections (-B = Negative Bulge, 0.0 = No Bulge, +B = Positive Bulge)"
   - D [Divisions]: "Number of mesh edge loop divisions per side of the mesh connection"
   - t [Weld Tolerance]: "The welding tolerance for the mesh joining if J is true (you won't need to change this unless join is true but does not make properly welded meshes)"

   OUTPUTS:
   - M [Mirror Cut]: "Resulting mirror cut meshes"
   - i [Split Index]: "The splitting index (only if Join is false)

To split the mirror cut mesh set at the mirror use this as the index input on Grasshopper's Split List component."
   - RP [Reach Plane]: "The plane at the reach distance"
   - OP [Offset Plane]: "The plane at the offset distance"
   - I [Intersected]: "True if the mesh was intersected by the mirror cut, False if the mesh was not intersected by the mirror cut"

----------------------------------------

## Tween Through Curves On Surface
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Curve)

   INPUTS:
   - C [Curves]: "Set of curves on surface to tween through"
   - S [Surface]: "Surface to tween curve on"
   - F [Factor]: "Tween factor (0.0 = Curve at index 0, Index number of last point = Curve at last index)

The tween factor range from one curve to the next curve in the list is:
Index number of a curve = the curve at that index, Index number of the next curve = the next curve in the list, numbers between the curve index numbers will be the corresponding tweens.

For instance:
A tween factor of 2.5 will result in a tween curve halfway between the curve at index 2 and the curve at index 3."
   - I [Interpolation Type]: "0 = Straight
1 = Normal
2 = Tight
3 = Uniform"
   - R [Refit]: "Optional Refit match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and curve degree of refit)

If an integer greater than zero, Refit match method is used if possible. When input curves are refit their control points are redistributed, added to, and removed from based on the curves curvature and the input integer degree, while trying to maintain their shapes. Refit results in tighter shaped tweens, with curvature based control point distribution."
   - P [Point Sample]: "Optional Point Sample match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and amount of sample points) 

If an integer greater than zero, Point Sample match method is used. When input curves are sampled their control points are recreated by equally dividing the curve by the input integer point count. Point Sample results in looser shaped tweens, with uniform control point distribution."

   OUTPUTS:
   - T [Tween]: "Resulting tween curve on surface"

----------------------------------------

## Is Arc/Circle/Ellipse
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Curve)

   INPUTS:
   - C [Curve]: "Curve to test for arc, circle, or ellipse"
   - t [Tolerance]: "Tolerance to determine if a curve is an arc, circle, or ellipse (if omitted RhinoMath zero distance tolerance (1.0e-12) is used)"

   - C [Circle]: "True if curve is a circle"

----------------------------------------

## V-Ray Render
   (Tab: V-Ray > Panel: Render)

   INPUTS:
   - Engine [Engine]: "Switches between the CPU, GPU CUDA, and GPU RTX (legacy) render engines.
Make sure to specify devices to be used by the CUDA and RTX engines using V-Ray's GPU Device Selection tool (V-Ray / Tools / GPU Device Selection). 
Please note that RTX is now a legacy engine and may be deprecated in future versions. It can only run on GPU devices with Compute Capability 5.2 or higher."
   - Sampler [Sampler]: "Switches between Progressive and Bucket sampling methods."
   - Quality [Quality]: "Controls the rendered image quality.
The option will only affect Production rendering."
   - Out Img [Output Image]: "Specifies the output image file location and type."
   - Output Res [Output Resolution]: "The resolution of the rendered image.
A pair of integers for width and height is expected."
   - • Camera [• Camera]: "Expects a V-Ray Camera input.
If there is no input the current active camera position will be used as render view.
Note: Make sure that there is no more than a single input for this parameter."
   - • Light [• Light]: "Expected V-Ray Light input.
Multiple inputs are accepted.
If there is no input, a simple pre-defined light is created."
   - • V Geo [• V Geometry]: "Expects a V-Ray Geometries input.
If there is no input a simple background color/gradient/image will be rendered.
Note: The input might have to be Flattened depending on the input data."
   - • Env [• Environment]: "Expected a single V-Ray Environment input."
   - • Timeline [• Timeline]: "Expects the input of a V-Ray Timeline component.
Initiating the render process will render a number of consecutive frames based on the Timeline’s Frames Count parameter.
Note: The Grasshopper definition will be evaluated for each frame."
   - • Elements [• Render Elements]: "V-Ray Render Elements"
   - • Swarm [• Swarm]: "A Swarm input specifying how to use the swarm network to perform distributed rendering."
   - Update Fx [Update Effects Frequency]: "Controls the regularity of post effects updates during progressive rendering - Denoiser, Lens Effects, Lighting Analysis.
It sets the approximate percentage of render time that is allotted to the effects evaluation.
A value between 0 and 100 should be used here.
Larger values cause the effect to be updated more frequently.
100 - Rapid - 100% of maximum frequency. Will cause updates as often as possible.
0 - At the End - 0% of maximum frequency. This disables progressive updates. Instead, effects will be applied after the render process has finished (but not if it is manually cancelled)."

   OUTPUTS:
   - • Scene [• Scene]: "V-Ray scene output.
Can be connected to a VRScene node in order for the scene to be exported to disk."

----------------------------------------

When you bake this surface into Rhino it will become a usual polysurface(Brep) which is split at its kinks if it has kinks, unless you first run the command CreaseSplitting in Rhino's command line and turn it off by switching it to No. If this surface has kinks you can turn it into a polysurface(Brep) using Pufferfish's Split Kinky Surface component."

## Weaverbird's Tile
   (Tab: Wb > Panel: Create)

   INPUTS:
   - M [Mesh/Curves]: "The open or closed mesh, or closed curves list, to subdivide"
   - F [FillStrategy]: "The filling strategy

0: Skip. No insertions at the targeted faces.
1: Best. Use the best combination available today.
2: Triangle Fan. A fan of triangles, with an addition center point.
3: Triangle Hand. A series of triangles, all pointing towards vertex zero.
4: Triangle Knit. Triangles start from vertex 0 and follow in rectangular way.
5: Triangle Zigzag. Triangles start from vertex 0 and alternate.
6: Quad Stitch. Lays quads except in last segment if it is odd.
7: Quad Fan. Adds a central point and positions quads every two edges."
   - O [Opt-in]: "Apply the tessellation to these faces

0: All Faces. All faces tessellation apply to.
1: Quads And More. All except triangles.
2: Penta And More. All except triangles and quads.
9: Tris. Triangles only.
16: Quads. Quads only."

   OUTPUTS:
   - O [Output Mesh/Curves]: "The mesh after the subdividing process"

----------------------------------------

## StepSolver
   (Tab: Kangaroo2 > Panel: Main)

   INPUTS:
   - GoalObjects [GoalObjects]: "GoalObjects"
   - Tolerance [Tolerance]: "Points closer than this distance will be combined into a single particle"
   - Momentum [Momentum]: "If false, the simulation tries to converge as quickly as possible. If true, the dynamics are more physically based"
   - Damping [Damping]: "Value between 0 and 1, for how much velocity is preserved between iterations. Only used if Momentum is on"
   - SubIterations [SubIterations]: "Number of iterations per frame"
   - Animate [Animate]: "If false, simulation resets. If true the solution will advance by one frame each time this input is received"

   OUTPUTS:
   - I [I]: "Iterations"
   - V [V]: "V"
   - O [O]: "GoalFunction Outputs"

## Slide Curve Along Curve
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Curve)

   INPUTS:
   - C [Curve]: "Curve to slide along guide curve"
   - G¹ [Guide 1]: "Guide curve to slide along"
   - G² [Guide 2]: "Optional second guide curve to slide along (best if flowing in the direction of Guide 1)"
   - F [Factor]: "Slide factor (0.0 = Slide start, 1.0 = Slide end)"
   - A [Align]: "Align the slide curve to the input curve, when using one guide curve"
   - R [Refit]: "Optional Refit match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and curve degree of refit)

If an integer greater than zero, Refit match method is used if possible. When input curves are refit their control points are redistributed, added to, and removed from based on the curves curvature and the input integer degree, while trying to maintain their shapes. Refit results in tighter shaped slides, with curvature based control point distribution."
   - P [Point Sample]: "Optional Point Sample match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and amount of sample points) 

If an integer greater than zero, Point Sample match method is used. When input curves are sampled their control points are recreated by equally dividing the curve by the input integer point count. Point Sample results in looser shaped slides, with uniform control point distribution."

   OUTPUTS:
   - S [Slide]: "Resulting slide curve along curve"

## Viewport Overrides
   (Tab: Rhino > Panel: Objects)

   INPUTS:
   - Object [Object]: "Model Object"
   - Viewport [Viewport]: "Viewport where to apply the overrides"
   - Display Mode [Display Mode]: "Mode to apply to the corresponding viewport"

   OUTPUTS:
   - Object [Object]: "Model Object"
   - Viewport [Viewport]: "Viewport where to apply the overrides"
   - Display Mode [Display Mode]: "Mode applied to the corresponding viewport"

----------------------------------------

## Round To Nearest
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Number)

   INPUTS:
   - x [Numbers X]: "Numbers to round"
   - y [Numbers Y]: "Numbers to round nearest to"
   - R [Remap x]: "Remap numbers x to domain of numbers y"

   OUTPUTS:
   - N [Nearest]: "Number in y nearest to number x (if Remap(R) is set to true then number in y nearest to remapped number x)"
   - xR [Remapped x]: "Remapped number x to domain of numbers y if Remap(R) is true. Same number as number x if Remap(R) is false"

----------------------------------------

   - D [Degree]: "Curvature degree of the tween path, degree should be a positive odd number"

0 = Linear
1 = Chord
2 = Square Root
3 = Uniform"

   (Tab: Bubalus_GH2.0 > Panel: Vray)

   INPUTS:
   - Run [Run]: "If True, run this component(Suggestion: Use Button component)"
   - Guid [Geometry Guid]: "Guid of the Vray proxy tree.(Suggestion: Create a block in Rhino.)"
   - P [Geometry Location]: "Vray proxy tree location point"
   - SD [Scale Domain]: "Random scaled by the interval （default:0.9 to 1.0) "
   - RD [Rotate  Domain]: "Random rotated by the interval （default:0 to 360) "
   - AR [Allocation Ratio]: "Allocation Ratio (numbers count is equal to trees count)"
   - P [Geometry Plane]: "If the plane parameter is empty, then plane is equal to the WorldXY. "
   - S [Seed]: "Seed of random engine "
   - A [Accurate]: "If true, return the lowest point or location of the geometry. Otherwise return the lowest center point of the geometry BoundingBox."

   OUTPUTS:
   - Guid [Guid]: "Guid of the planted Vray proxy tree"

## V-Ray Volume Scattering
   (Tab: V-Ray > Panel: Scatter)

   INPUTS:
   - Instances Count [Instances Count]: "Determines the exact number of instances to scatter."
   - Per Volume [Per Cubic Volume]: "When enabled, the total number of instances is determined by the ‘Cubic Volume Size’ value combined with the size of the host’s bounding box volume."
   - Volume Size [Cubic Volume Size]: "The value specifies the length of the cube’s side used to measure volume distribution. If the ‘Instances Count’ value is set to 1, this number determines the relative density for all instances."

   OUTPUTS:
   - • Scattering [• Scattering Configuration]: "Configuration data specifying surface scattering mode. Can be connected to the V-Ray Scatter 2 component’s ‘Scattering Configuration’ input."

----------------------------------------

## Tween Consecutive Points On Surface
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Point)

   INPUTS:
   - P [Points]: "Set of points on surface to tween between"
   - S [Surface]: "Surface to tween points on"
   - F [Factor]: "Tween factor (0.0 = Point at P, 1.0 = Point at P +1)"
   - W [Weighted]: "If True, tween distribution is weighted by the input point set and the tween path curvature"
   - L [Loopback]: "If True, allow the tween path to continue from the end back to the start as a closed loop"
   - D [Degree]: "Curvature degree of the tween path, degree should be a positive odd number"
   - I [Interpolation Type]: "Determines how the tween path is interpolated

0 = Linear
1 = Chord
2 = Square Root
3 = Uniform"

   OUTPUTS:
   - T [Tween]: "Resulting tween points on surface"

If False, the domain is decreasing (positive to negative)"

## Tween Through Curves
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Curve)

   INPUTS:
   - C [Curves]: "Set of curves to tween through"
   - F [Factor]: "Tween factor (0.0 = Curve at C start, 1.0 = Curve at C end), unless Normalized is False"
   - N [Normalized]: "If False, the rules for factor are (0.0 = Curve at index 0, Index number of last curve = Curve at last index)

The tween factor range from one curve to the next curve in the list is:
Index number of a curve = the curve at that index, Index number of the next curve = the next curve in the list, factors between the curve index numbers will be the corresponding tweens.

For instance:
A tween factor of 2.5 will result in a tween curve halfway between the curve at index 2 and the curve at index 3."
   - E [Equalized]: "If True, tween distribution is evaluated along the tween path without considering the locations of the input curve set"
   - L [Loopback]: "If True, allow the tween path to continue from the end back to the start as a closed loop
(if Normalized is False, increase the tween factor range maximum by 1)"
   - I [Interpolation Type]: "Determines how the tween path is interpolated

0 = Straight
1 = Normal
2 = Tight
3 = Uniform"
   - R [Refit]: "Optional Refit match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and curve degree of refit)

If an integer greater than zero, Refit match method is used if possible. When input curves are refit their control points are redistributed, added to, and removed from based on the curves curvature and the input integer degree, while trying to maintain their shapes. Refit results in tighter shaped tweens, with curvature based control point distribution."
   - P [Point Sample]: "Optional Point Sample match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and amount of sample points) 

If an integer greater than zero, Point Sample match method is used. When input curves are sampled their control points are recreated by equally dividing the curve by the input integer point count. Point Sample results in looser shaped tweens, with uniform control point distribution."

   OUTPUTS:
   - T [Tween]: "Resulting tween curve"

----------------------------------------

## Nonlinear Regression
   (Tab: LunchBoxML > Panel: Accord.net)

   INPUTS:
   - Test [Test Data]: "Tree of data to test against training data."
   - Inputs [Training Inputs]: "Tree list of training inputs."
   - Output [Training Output]: "The list of training outputs."
   - Sigma [Sigma]: "Sigma of prediction curve"
   - Complex [Complexity]: "Complexity of the prediction"
   - Seed [Random Seed]: "Seed for number generator."

   OUTPUTS:
   - Result [Result]: "Resultant prediction"
   - Score [Score]: "The predicted scores"
   - Error [Error]: "Error between the expected and predicted"

   - S [Starting index]: "Default 1"
   - C [Quantity of filenames]: "Default -1 (doesn't output multiple names)"
   - OK [Generate next]: "Set to true to generate the next filepath"
   - R [Reset]: "Set to true to reset internal counter. Resetting won't bypass file existence check. We recommend to use the menu entry in the context menu as it doesn't trigger recomputation."

   OUTPUTS:

   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Surface)

   INPUTS:
   - S [Surfaces]: "Set of surfaces to tween between"
   - F [Factor]: "Tween factor (0.0 = Surface at S, 1.0 = Surface at S +1)"
   - W [Weighted]: "If True, tween distribution is weighted by the input surface set and the tween path curvature"
   - D [Degree]: "Curvature degree of the tween path, degree should be a positive odd number"
   - I [Interpolation Type]: "Determines how the tween path is interpolated

0 = Linear
1 = Chord
2 = Square Root
3 = Uniform"
   - R [Refit]: "Optional Refit match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and surface degree of refit)

If an integer greater than zero, Refit match method is used if possible. When input surfaces are refit their control points are redistributed, added to, and removed from based on the surfaces curvature and the input integer degree, while trying to maintain their shapes. Refit results in tighter shaped tweens, with curvature based control point distribution."
   - P [Point Sample]: "Optional Point Sample match method.
(No Integer or 0 = Off, Integer greater than 0 = On and amount of sample points) 

If an integer greater than zero, Point Sample match method is used. When input surfaces are sampled their control points are recreated by equally dividing the surface by the input integer point count. Point Sample results in looser shaped tweens, with uniform control point distribution."

   OUTPUTS:

## Tween Through Meshes
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: Mesh)

   INPUTS:
   - M [Meshes]: "Set of meshes to tween through"
   - F [Factor]: "Tween factor (0.0 = Mesh at index 0, Index number of last mesh = Mesh at last index)

The tween factor range from one mesh to the next mesh in the list is:
Index number of a mesh = the mesh at that index, Index number of the next mesh = the next mesh in the list, numbers between the mesh index numbers will be the corresponding tweens.

For instance:
A tween factor of 2.5 will result in a tween mesh halfway between the mesh at index 2 and the mesh at index 3."
   - I [Interpolation Type]: "0 = Linear
1 = Chord
2 = Square Root
3 = Uniform"

   OUTPUTS:
   - T [Tween]: "Resulting tween mesh"

## Mirror Cut Items
   (Tab: Pufferfish > Panel: List)

   INPUTS:
   - L [Items]: "Set of list items to mirror cut"
   - Mi [Mirror Index]: "Index that the kept side of the list item set cut gets mirrored across.
Negative index reverses the mirror set and removes from the top."
   - F [Flip]: "Flip the mirror direction (False = Mirror after index, True = Mirror before index)"
   - J [Join]: "Join the mirror cut list item set (removes the duplicate list item in the middle of the set)"

   OUTPUTS:
   - M [Mirror Cut]: "Resulting mirror cut list items set"
   - i [Split Index]: "The splitting index (only if Join is false)

To split the mirror cut list item set at the mirror use this as the index input on Grasshopper's Split List component."
   - I [Intersected]: "True if the mirror index intersected the list item set, False if the mirror index did not intersect the list item set"

----------------------------------------

## Ordinate Dimension
   (Tab: Rhino > Panel: Annotations)

   INPUTS:
   - Ordinate Dimension [Ordinate Dimension]: "The Rhino ordinate dimension"
   - Plane [Plane]: "The base plane from which the dimension is measured from."
   - Direction [Direction]: "Measurement Direction: 
1) Base Plane X-axis
2) Base Plane Y-axis
"
   - Feature Location [Feature Location]: "The location of the dimensioned feature."
   - Dimension Location [Dimension Location]: "The location of the endpoint of the ordinate dimension leader"
   - Offset 1 [Offset 1]: "Offset distance to the first jog (ie. kink) in the leader"
   - Offset 2 [Offset 2]: "Offset distance to the second jog (ie. kink) in the leader"

   OUTPUTS:
   - Ordinate Dimension [Ordinate Dimension]: "The Rhino ordinate dimension"
   - Plane [Plane]: "The base plane from which the dimension is measured from."
   - Direction [Direction]: "Measurement Direction: 
1) Base Plane X-axis
2) Base Plane Y-axis
"
   - Feature Location [Feature Location]: "The location of the dimensioned feature."
   - Dimension Location [Dimension Location]: "The location of the endpoint of the ordinate dimension leader"
   - Offset 1 [Offset 1]: "Offset distance to the first jog (ie. kink) in the leader"
   - Offset 2 [Offset 2]: "Offset distance to the second jog (ie. kink) in the leader"

----------------------------------------

## Brep Volume Moments
   (Tab: Surface > Panel: Analysis)

   INPUTS:
   - B [Brep]: "Base Brep"

   OUTPUTS:
   - V [Volume]: "Volume of Brep"
   - C [Centroid]: "Volume centroid of Brep"
   - I [Inertia]: "Moments of inertia around the centroid"
   - I± [Inertia (error)]: "Errors on Moments of inertia"
   - S [Secondary]: "Secondary moments of inertia around the centroid"
   - S± [Secondary (error)]: "Errors on Secondary moments"
   - G [Gyration]: "Radii of gyration"

----------------------------------------

## Curve On Surface
   (Tab: Curve > Panel: Spline)

   INPUTS:
   - S [Surface]: "Base surface"
   - uv [UV coordinates]: "{v} coordinates of interpolation points"
   - C [Closed]: "Closed curve"

   OUTPUTS:
   - C [Curve]: "Resulting nurbs curve"
   - L [Length]: "Curve length"
   - D [Domain]: "Curve domain"

----------------------------------------
